fields.description:
After having a few versions already entered (2.0, 2.1, 2.2), I added a previous version, 1.24.  It is displayed last in all of the lists.  Can the versions be sorted by their numeric value?  This is a (minor) problem because the future versions push the more present version (1.24) to be off screen (only 3 on the road map by default).

Thanks,

Adam
fields.summary: Version sort order in Road Map view
Ability to create Notification Scheme based on issue priority

fields.description:
It is possible that the project developers would not want users to edit issues in regards to for which version it needs to be fixed and what the priority is.

I would propose that when a user vote for a project, he can supply a personal priority for the issue.  All the personal priorities would then be averaged to determine the general priority of the user community.

You would thus have 2 priorities, one assigned by the developers and one by the users. The latter could serve as a guideline to the developers on what the communities wishes are.
fields.summary: Have voters assign a priority which would give indication of urgency

fields.description: If you define in a permission scheme that a group has "resolve issues" permission but NOT "close issues" permission, they're still able to close the issue because the "Resolve & Close" button is always visible.
fields.summary: Users can close issues even if they don't have the "Close issues" permission

fields.description: Correct for 'unassigned' issues, incorrect for all others.
fields.summary: Your Votes page shows incorrect label

fields.description: With LDAPCredentialsProvider, authentication is not case-sensitive.  If you login with different case (eg: UserA) to that which is recorded in Jira (eg: usera), filters involving username (eg: Assigned to Me, In Progress etc.) return no results.
fields.summary: Filters break when you login via LDAP with incorrect case

fields.description:
Would it be possible to include a field allowing the hex colour specific priorities to be changed?

At present, our wishlist has defaulted to a dark red making our projects look ominously behind schedule whereas it's really just issues to implement "nice to have" features at a later date ;)
fields.summary: Changing colors of priorities in "open issues" bar display

fields.description:
We are unable to control the prioritisation order of the list.  We have added a wishlist priority and this currently appears a the top of the list followed by trivial, minor, major, etc.

As such, all our critical and blocker items are filtered off the end of this list (it appears to only display a set number of items).
fields.summary: Home Page - Open Issues: Assigned To Me - list order

fields.description:
(apologies if this is a duplicate, I was unable to find any related issues)

We use all uppercase project codes so we have issue tags such as IT-10, ACA-422 etc.

When searching via the quick search, entering it-10 comes up with no results, whereas IT-10 takes us straight to the issue.
fields.summary: Quick Search should not be case sensitive
Ability to forward issues to other users

fields.description: When querying issues and including "Comments", the issue comments are not queried. No results are obtained. When the other issue properties are queried (e.g. "description") everything works fine.
fields.summary: Issue query on comment doesn't work

fields.description: A couple users are reporting that they cannot see all their assigned and in progress issues on the dashboard. If the users have too many issues in progress or assigned, does the dashboard list them all or does it have a fixed maximum number of rows?
fields.summary: Missing issues on dashboard if there a too many to list.

fields.description: If you accidently put the wrong attachment up you have to ask the Admin to delete it. The reporter of a bug should be able to delete attachments. Others shouldn't, but the person who owners it should have that ability. Apparently it's not a permission that is configurable.
fields.summary: No way to delete attachements

fields.description:
If two users (A & B) are looking at the same issue:

If user A deletes the issue that user B is resolving, user B will see a 500 error (from two NPE's).

Essentially, it is because AbstractIssueSelectAction.getIssue() can return null - and null is not checked for.

fields.summary: Resolve Issue - NullPointerException

fields.description:
If two users (A & B) are looking at the same issue:

If user A deletes the issue that user B is adding a comment to, user B will get a misleading error message:

"You do not have permission to comment on issues in this project"

Where in fact, it has nothing to do with permissions. The real problem is that the issue is invalid (and probably deleted/moved).
fields.summary: Add Comment - invalid error message

fields.description: There is no description field or notes associated with uploading a file.  It is difficult to know what is in the file or to differentiate when there are multiple files attached.  During the attachment process you can only add a comment which isn't directly related to the attachment.
fields.summary: Add descriptions to file attachments

fields.description: There is no description field or notes associated with uploading a file.  It is difficult to know what is in the file or to differentiate when there are multiple files attached.  During the attachment process you can only add a comment which isn't directly related to the attachment.
fields.summary: Add descriptions to file attachments

fields.description:
The help page for notifications doesn't explain what the different notifications mean.  For instance, I didn't realize at first that "Current Reporter" means "Original Reporter", and I still don't know what "Current User" means.  (Is it the person making the change?)

For most of the options, the meaning is fairly intuitive, but not the first three.
fields.summary: Explain notifications in help page

fields.description:
We just upgraded from 2.0 to 2.3 yesterday.

We have notifications for "Issue Assigned" set to "Current Assignee" and "All Watchers".  Twice now, someone has assigned an issue to me, which properly sends me a notification, and then I have assigned the issue to someone else, which improperly sends me an additional notification.

The assignee is also being notified, so it's not a big problem, but it makes me wonder what else might be wrong.
fields.summary: Too many notifications

fields.description:
We have a requirement to link to items in Lotus Notes, which we can do using a registry hack and the notes:// protocol.  Currently, Jira does not understand this protocol, so does not convert to a hyperlink.

Please could we add notes:// to the list of protocols understood?  There are loads of others that might be useful; I'm not sure if they're included at the moment.  e.g.

notes://
gopher://
file:///
ftp://

etc...
fields.summary: Hyperlink other protocols (e.g. notes://) automatically

fields.description:
In earlier versions, resolving an unassigned issue would also change its assignment to that of whoever resolved the issue, this is no longer happening.

We noticed this behaviour after investigating resolved items not showing up in filters ( unassigned issues arn't included in the stats/filters from the dashboard ).
fields.summary: Resolving an issue thats not assigned no longer assigns it to the resolver

fields.description:
to recreate
1. load JP file
2. search on }ì↑J╚
3. notice chacter are corrupted.. see screen shot
fields.summary: double byte character corrupted by reader

fields.description: When creating an account I would like to be able to choose what type of email I get, html or text instead of just defaulting to text.  Either that or be able to set the default to html through the admin interface.
fields.summary: Choose email type on account creation

fields.description:
According to issue JRA-648, it should be possible to create a linked
issue automatically from within an existing issue without having to 
create a new issue first and then link to the original issue from 
within this new issue. Another nice feature would be the possibility 
to let the total estimated time be automatically the sum of all of its subissues (of course this makes most sense when dealing with subissues that are grouped together into one "super-issue"). The user can then decide whether to use this "sum of time" feature or not.
fields.summary: "sum of time" feature

fields.description:
I'm searching through the list of users, using the UserBrowser Administration option.  As we have over 600 users, I don't particularly want to have to step through them 20 at a time, so I set the Users per Page to 100.  After clicking the Filter button, it shows the first 100 users.  However, when I click on either the "2" or "Next" links at the bottom of the page, instead of showing me 101-200 I get 101-120 and the filter setting has reset to 20.  So beyond the first hundred, there's no way to avoid having to do it 20 names at a time :-(

The problem seems to be that the links' HREFs only contain the 'start' parameter, and not the 'max' value.  If I type
http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa?start=100&max=100
directly into the address bar, I get nos. 101 to 200 as expected.
fields.summary: "Users per Page" gets reset in UserBrowser when you page through the results
Allow searching for users by full name or username in User Admin page

fields.description:
We should store the startup time in the servlet context (using the consistency checker), and then access it from the system info page.

That way we can tell how long JIRA has been up for?

Scott
fields.summary: System Info page should store uptime

fields.description:
We're currently evaluating Jira for purchase, and have run across a bug.

I've created several projects within Jira, and I realized that no emails were being generated when people added comments.  I went back to the project settings, and assigned the "Default Notification Scheme" to the project, which has sufficient settings for our needs.

After making this change, I can see new mail messages added to the queue when the events fire.

However, the messages never clear from the queue.  If I click the "Flush Mail Queue" link, the messages never leave the queue.

I can use the "Send a Test Email" message functionality successfully.

Another oddity: Only the notification generated messages refuse to send.  If I create a new account, I see the Account Created message go in the queue, and if I flush the queue, it gets sent fine, but the three "Comment" messages above it are ignored.


I checked the "catalina.out" file and found a lot of error messages.  Here is a snippet:

recipients.size() = 0
java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:394)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:476)

        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:213)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:193)
        at com.atlassian.core.security.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:170)

I'll add the full error message as an attachment (it's long).
fields.summary: Error when flushing mail queue

fields.description:
special characters like éçàù aren't displayed in the interface.
When I type them in there are shown correctly but when creaing or updating the isue the chars are changed to ? or an other exotic char.
In the database the char is this correct until I perform a restore then there all changed in the database
fields.summary: Special characters aren't displayed

fields.description: when moving an issue to a project with only one version, this version is not displayed ("unknown" only)
fields.summary: move issue : "target" version not displayed if alone

fields.description: I would like to "allow unassigned" _only for some_ of our projects.
fields.summary: project-level "allow unassigned"

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to select the fields you want to display as a result of a filter you create. For example, I was trying to get the "Fix for Version" to be displayed in a filter that displayed all unresolved bugs for my project, but could find no way to change the default fields. The "Fix for Version" field would have been extremely useful to display in this particular filter. It would also be helpful to be able to predefine a sort field for a filter, though this is easily corrected by clicking the field after the filter results display (it is a bit annoying to have to go through this extra step though).

I was debating whether this was Major or Minor priority and finally decided on Major because not having selectable fields in the filters severely hampers the capability and usefulness of the filters, though they are still very helpful as is.
fields.summary: Selectable Fields for Filters

fields.description:
When I click on Link this Issue jira just clears the browser window! 

There are no error messages


Please see also:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-2080
fields.summary: Link this Issue brings up empty window

fields.description:
When I click on reopen Issue on a resolved closed Issue jira just emties the browser window!

There are no error messages
fields.summary: reopen Issue brings empty Window

fields.description:
I would like to see reporter and component owner (idea behind JRA-1438) to be options when assigning an issue.  

In our company (and I believe most others) a QA person enters the issue (reporter) and then a developer fixes the issue (component owner) and then forwards the issue back to the QA person.  The issue may bounce back and forth between QA and development but typically its still back and forth to the same two people.

Since most bugs will go through this flow, it would be nice to just put these special values into the assignment selection list.
fields.summary: Reporter and Component Owner as selection options in assignment

fields.description:
When installing 2.3 upgrade, we noticed many exceptions like the following in our log.

Upon poking into the issue, we discovered that the tables had been created with all lowercase names.  With MySQL on a Unix server, the database and table names are case sensitive ('cuz the filesystem is).

While I did a complete rebuild of the db with the upgrade (that is, i dropped all of the tables before upgrading so Jira would recreate) - it would be ideal if the startup didn't error out.

Do you have any suggestions?  I was surprised others hadn't run into this in the forums.

Cheers,

   java.sql.SQLException: General error,  message from server: "Table 'jira.CHANGEGROUP' doesn't exist"
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:1626)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:886)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:945)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQuery(MysqlIO.java:917)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.execSQL(Connection.java:1841)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.execSQL(Connection.java:1775)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.Statement.executeQuery(Statement.java:1220)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.DatabaseMetaData.getIndexInfo(DatabaseMetaData.java:2127)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil.getIndexInfo(DatabaseUtil.java:1122)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil.checkDb(DatabaseUtil.java:499)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.checkDb(GenericDAO.java:1413)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.checkDataSource(GenericHelperDAO.java:270)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.<init>(GenericDelegator.java:144)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.getGenericDelegator(GenericDelegator.java:86)
        at com.atlassian.core.CoreFactory.getGenericDelegator(CoreFactory.java:33)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.checkConnection(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:134)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.checkConsistency(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:93)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.initialise(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:78)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyLauncher.contextInitialized(ConsistencyLauncher.java:18)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3269)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:3598)
fields.summary: Exceptions on startup with MySQL on Linux

fields.description:
404 when I try to add a new Component or new Version to any of my projects (new install, there have never been any components or versions).

type Status report

message No view for result [input] exists for action [AddVersion!default]

description The requested resource (No view for result [input] exists for action [AddVersion!default]) is not available.
fields.summary: Can't add new Versions or components

fields.description:
On the view issue page when an issue is not resolved, you don't see any resolution. Good, you shouldn't.

However, when in the issue navigator you always see the resolution column, many times taking up a lot of space by saying "UNRESOLVED".

What about combining the display of the issue status?  Remove the resolution column, and when an issue is resolved or closed, display it like so:

[icon] Resolved: Fixed
[icon] Closed: Won't Fix

This would save some space now that we have the due date field? Would only remove the ability to sort by the resolution field. Just thinking about it - this design idea is/will be affected by custom issue navigator columns and custom workflow.
fields.summary: Combine display of status and resolution

fields.description:
See http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-1920

This is an issue I personally added to the system, but now it shows the reporter as being 'Dave Loeng'. Also the first comment are seemingly to be written by Dave, while this is actually from Scott. Second comment is also not from Dave.
fields.summary: Wrong username for Reporter and commenter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2073].
  {panel}

You cannot delete a user when the user reported issues and has issues assigned. 
What I want is to deactivate a user so that all assigned issues are automatically assigned a specified user (or if not specified the project lead) and the user has no longer rights to login to the system.
This is to support the possibility of members leaving the project.

Workaround: Ban user from all groups and manually reassign all the users issues.
fields.summary: Deactivating user - assigning all issues to other user

fields.description:
We should allow custom fields to be specified on the resolution screens (and potentially other workflow screens).

This would allow things like work logging & other custom fields to be edited on issue resolve.
fields.summary: Allow custom fields on the resolution page

fields.description:
At the moment we can specify descriptions for input fields, but not for issue type (in the Look and Feel page of the Administration section).

We should fix that :)
fields.summary: Can't specify description for issue type

fields.description:
In the UserBrowser, if you select 100 Users per page, then hit next, you find yourself looking again at 20 users per page.

You also see all the menus for << Previous 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | .....etc
fields.summary: UserBrowser forgets "Users Per Page" setting when hitting "next"

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to create Issue types that would only be available for a specific set of projects.
fields.summary: Ability to create new issue types only for specific projects

fields.description:
The wording for the scope navigation on the change log is the same as that for the road map.  It should probably be different.

Current:

  Change Log
  - Scope: next 3 versions | all versions

Should be:

  Change Log
  - Scope: last 3 versions | all versions
fields.summary: Wording for scope navigation on change log
Allow administrator to turn off "Email me when I make changes:"

fields.description:
Export JIRA data .............. Form Errors: An exception occurred exporting: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@772d2, result: error
Error exporting: java.io.IOException: The character '' is an invalid XML character It would does not help that this char is an invalid one, there should be also a hint where (in which dataset) this char is located! I am not able to update from 2.0.2 to 2.3 or are there no changes in the databasemodel
fields.summary: Invalid XML characters when exporting data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2065].
  {panel}

After using Jira for some time and having just compleated out first release cycle, we've come up with a few "issues".

Several issues in our database which were fixed in this release, were inadvertantly resolved with a fix-for in a later version.  Initially the issues where set for a later release but were fixed now instead.

What we're finding, now that the issues are closed, and the version released, the closed issues still show in the roadmap for the next release.

Currently theres no way to change the fix-for field for these issues without first re-opening each, and changing the field, and closing.

What would be good is an easy to handle this, possibly via the merge versions section.  ( i.e. merge all closed issues in 2.0.1 into 2.0.0 ).
fields.summary: Move closed issues from future release to "released" release

fields.description: At the moment if you turn on 'allow unassigned issues', issues are unassigned by default. Sometimes you would want them to be automatically assigned to the project lead, even if unassigned issues were turned on. We should make this another option in the General Configuration page.
fields.summary: Add new option 'Automatically assign project lead'

fields.description:
The due date is not specified in email notifications.
Just al little thing....
fields.summary: Due date not specified in email notifications.

fields.description: I've noticed when I have multiple boxes in the left sidebar of my dashboard (I have sets of filters being displayed) that there is a missing spacer between boxes (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Dashboard boxes need an additional spacer in the left column

fields.description: I'm glad to see the search box in the header is getting more useful, however we found it to be way too small so I edited one of the header JSPs and make the box much wider. You might find this useful for a future version of Jira (see attached screen shot).
fields.summary: Widen search box in header
Giving customers partial permission to browse projects

fields.description:
One feature that I miss is the opportunity to assign many users to one or more groups in one screen.

In this version I have to edit each user and change the group membership.
fields.summary: Assign users to group in one operation

fields.description:
I have a.. thing about URI spaces. They ought to be clean, user-hackable, bookmarkable, extension-free, ReST-friendly.  JIRA's URLs are none of the these.  It is not possible to bookmark "the issue tracker for project X" without embedding some horribly brittle project ID:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10470

Instead, we could have:

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/confluence

And linking to individual bugs; instead of:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-563

Why couldn't we just have:

http://jira.atlassian.com/JRA-563

or:

http://jira.atlassian.com/jira/563

For more indoctrination along these lines, see:

http://www.w3.org/Provider/Style/URI.html


--Jeff
fields.summary: JIRA URL space not bookmark-friendly

fields.description:
When starting up Tomcat I regularly get these errors:

Cannot serialize session attribute os_security_defaultauthenticator_user for session B597724A1D77E39A38057FFFD20954ED
fields.summary: Session objects not serializable

fields.description:
From Mike Porter via email:


1. When deleting an issue, the e-mail notification still has the wording and link to view the issue.  Obviously, since the issue is deleted, this is useless.
fields.summary: Email notification for delete issue still links to issue

fields.description: I created a search filter and named it but noticed it has a sharing priveledge of private.  How do I change it to public
fields.summary: How do I make a filter public

fields.description:
If iI try to backup my JIRA-Data using function "Backup Data to XML" the following error occurs: An exception occurred backing up: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@8a1f38, result: error
Error exporting: java.io.IOException: The character '�' is an invalid XML character
fields.summary: Error on "Backup Data to XML"

fields.description:
Currently, propertysets are loaded via PropertySetManager.getInstance(name, props).

This works for the default installation, however it will not work in the case where propertyset is deployed as an ejb, with the ofbiz propertyset deployed separately as part of the jira app (weird setup I know).

The solution is pretty simple and will work for everyone, just change that call to use the overloaded version that also takes in a classloader, and pass in the current class' classloader.

So in PropertyUtils.getPropertySet:

        return PropertySetManager.getInstance("ofbiz", ofbizArgs, PropertyUtils.class.getClassLoader());

In PropertiesManager:

        PropertySet ofbizPs = PropertySetManager.getInstance("ofbiz", ofbizArgs, getClass().getClassLoader());
fields.summary: PropertySet Classloader issues

fields.description: It would be handy to have the possibility to bulk change the type of one, more or all issue links when viewing the "link administration" of a certain issue. E.g. when one wants to change all "subissues" to "related issues". Now this can only be achieved by removing the links and recreating them as the new link types.
fields.summary: Bulk change issue link type

fields.description:
Is there anyway to assign a email event to a project?


For example:
     If I had a weekly report I wanted from a team, can I setup an email that would require an attachment /entry on a page before the email would stop? (Basically a response weekly)
fields.summary: Email Reminders

fields.description:
We should probably have another group 'Logged In Users' which I think is what people really want here.

And not allow people to add 'Anyone' to places where you need a specific user.
fields.summary: Adding the 'Anyone' group to assignable users causes problems

fields.description:
Scenario:

I've opened a lot of issues that were resolved.  If they shouldn't have closed, I would have complained about them.  Since I haven't, I'd like to close them all in one bulk operation.
fields.summary: Close all resolved issues that you've opened

fields.description: What is really missing from JIRA from our point of view is to be able to create component hierarchies within a project and to version components rather than an entire project.  In addition, a component in one project should be able to be 're-used' in another by cross-referencing to that components project (the one in which it is really managed and developed). If this were implemented we would also like to be able to indicate version dependencies, and generate compatible version graphs, etc.
fields.summary: Hierarachical versioned components, with cross-referencing

fields.description:
Previously, I used to jump directly to issues by entering the number in the search box at the top right of the screen.  This was particularly useful when checking through issues prior to a release to make sure e.g. the Fixed In version has been set properly (I had a list of ones to be checked).

Since our (XDoclet's) JIRA recently got upgraded to 2.3, this no longer works.  Instead of jumping to the issue, it runs a query searching for the issue no. in summary & description fields.  This would be reasonable enough, except that the issue whose number I entered in the search field is rarely one of those listed...

For example, browse the XDoclet project at http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/Dashboard.jspa and try entering "XDT-557" in the search field.  This is a new issue (that I only created less than half an hour ago), so there should be no way anything else has referred to it yet.  However, 14 issues are returned in the list, none of which is XDT-557 itself!  At least if XDT-557 had been included, I could get to it with a single mouse click (not quite as streamlined as the old behaviour, but I could live with it).

Perhaps the issue number could be added to the fields used by the Quick Search?
fields.summary: quick search doesn't find issue numbers

fields.description:
Reference email list for subject: "[JIRA-user] big problems: jira_2.3 on sapdb_7.3.0.34" for additional information.

On db schema creation in the initial load of the app in Tomcat the setup logs that foreign key creation fails due to syntax errors. Also, duplicate definition attempts of already created indexes are logged.

Solution for adding foreign keys: 
  change logged ALTER statements and rerun, see example below 
  or reference emails sent to list.

ALTER TABLE jiraaction ADD CONSTRAINT PARENTISSUE FOREIGN KEY (issueid)
REFERENCES jiraissue (ID) INITIALLY DEFERRED

should read 

ALTER TABLE jiraaction ADD FOREIGN KEY PARENTISSUE (issueid) REFERENCES
jiraissue (ID)

Also, the creation of the FK [ALTER TABLE customfield ADD FOREIGN KEY PARENTISSUETYPE (ISSUETYPE) REFERENCES issuetype (ID)] fails because issuetype(ID) is 60 chars whereby customfield(ISSUETYPE) is 255 chars long. Changing issuetype(ID) to be 255 chars allows the FK to be created.

I am going to add the rest of the foreign keys and will append any other errors found via the comments section.
fields.summary: db schema creation on sapdb has errors (resolutions provided)

fields.description:
In the "Issues Assigned to Me" Portlet:

-- Only the first 10 issues are shown, but there is no indication that there are actually a lot more than 10, so the user can easily misjudge the number of issues assigned to them at any given moment.

SUGGESTION: show a count such as 1 to 10 of 17 in some conspicuous place, like you do in the filters.

-- The issues are sorted from least critical to most critical so that if there are 7 blockers, and 10 trivial, the user sees only 10 trivial issues on their dashboard.  

SUGESTION: It seems much more valuable to show the most critical first so they do not get overlooked.
fields.summary: Issues Assigned to me Portlet has "Issues"

fields.description:
It is considered bad form in tomcat-land to have a web app log to stdout.log and stderr.log as these files can grow out of control and don't roll over nightly.  Instead please update the tomcat context to look like this:

<Context path="/jira" docBase="F:\jira\expanded">
+  <Logger className="org.apache.catalina.logger.FileLogger" debug="0" directory="logs" prefix="jira_log." suffix=".txt" timestamp="true" verbosity="1"/>
  <Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"/>
fields.summary: [PATCH] Add logging to the tomcat context

fields.description: The Permission "Assign Issues" was granted to "Current Assignee". Because of this permission on new Issues the "Current Reporter" was able to assign Issues (after revoking this permission from "Current Assignee" the "Current Reporter" wasn't able to do this).
fields.summary: Permission "Assign Issues" for "Current Assignee" doesn't work right

fields.description:
In the new permission scheme (and maybe the old one, but we never found this before), the 'reopen' permission is granted to users with the 'resolve' permission.  It seems to me that this permission should instead be linked with the 'close' permission.

As developers, we resolve issues for our users to test.  They have 'close' permission, but not 'resolve' permission.  So, if the issue they are testing turns out not to be fixed as required, they have no means of reopening the issue.  Whilst this is good news for us developers, the users are less happy :)
fields.summary: Reopen permission seems counterintuitive

fields.description:
Could you please make the issue types and severities specific for each project?
This would allow one project to have severities, say of Sev 1 to Sev 4, and another to use 'Critical, Major, Minor'? 

The same goes for issue types.

Both would help as it gives much more flexibility to each project.
fields.summary: Project specific Issue Types and Severities

fields.description:
(From mailing list:)

Earlier on I was complaining that jira 2.3 produces some strange errors unders resin ->

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=3478&tstart=15

...Joseph Dane had some seen something similar -> http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=3213&messageID=72241532#72241532

 

Anyway, I noticed that when doing a clean install of jira 2.3, you get

mysql> select * from propertyentry where entity_id >= 10000 and entity_id <= 10006;
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+
| ID    | ENTITY_NAME          | ENTITY_ID | PROPERTY_KEY | propertytype |
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+
| 10009 | OSUser               |     10000 | email        |            5 |
| 10010 | OSUser               |     10000 | fullName     |            5 |
| 10021 | PortletConfiguration |     10000 | template     |            5 |
| 10022 | PortletConfiguration |     10000 | description  |            5 |
| 10023 | PortletConfiguration |     10001 | template     |            5 |
| 10024 | PortletConfiguration |     10001 | description  |            5 |
| 10025 | PortletConfiguration |     10002 | template     |            5 |
| 10026 | PortletConfiguration |     10002 | description  |            5 |
| 10027 | PortletConfiguration |     10003 | template     |            5 |
| 10028 | PortletConfiguration |     10003 | description  |            5 |
| 10029 | PortletConfiguration |     10004 | template     |            5 |
| 10030 | PortletConfiguration |     10004 | description  |            5 |
| 10031 | PortletConfiguration |     10005 | template     |            5 |
| 10032 | PortletConfiguration |     10005 | description  |            5 |
| 10033 | PortletConfiguration |     10006 | template     |            5 |
| 10034 | PortletConfiguration |     10006 | description  |            5 |
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+


Now everything works ok with this..

If you compare this to the earlier (jira 2.3, upgrade done from 1.4.3)->

mysql> select * from propertyentry where entity_id >= 10000 and entity_id <= 10006;
+-------+-------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+
| ID | ENTITY_NAME | ENTITY_ID | PROPERTY_KEY | propertytype |
+-------+-------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+
| 10022 | OSUser | 10000 | email | 5 |
| 10023 | OSUser | 10000 | fullName | 5 |
+-------+-------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)

 

So I'm just wondering why the upgrade failed...
fields.summary: Upgrade to 2.3 produces incorrect data

fields.description: I'm not sure how the project key was created in uppercase, but issues show up as, "MA-45".  When using quick search, typing "ma-45" returns no matches.  According to my co-worker, it used to.
fields.summary: when using quick search to find an issue, project key must be uppercase

fields.description: CVSspam (http://www.badgers-in-foil.co.uk/projects/cvsspam/) generates nice html messages on CVS commits. They can include links to viewcvs (and some other web cvs viewers), so you can easily see changes in the code required to fix/implement this issue.
fields.summary: CVSLogHandler doesn't parse messages generated by CVSspam

fields.description:
Create a new project with some components.
Project page lists no components with outstanding bugs. good.
Create a bug with a component.
Project page lists 1 components with 1 outstanding bug. good.
Delete the bug
Project page lists 1 components with 1 outstanding bug as before, and a 'No component' component with -1 bugs. Bad.
fields.summary: per-Compoenent summary on project page broken.

fields.description: The bar that is red should be green & vice versa
fields.summary: System memory information should be the opposite colours

fields.description:
(via email from David Aldrich)

Hi

I have an email notification problem with JIRA 2.3 that can be
reproduced as follows:

Preconditions:
1) Enable notification by email of changes that I make 
2) Enable notification to "Current Assignee" on event "Issue Assigned"

Method:
1) Create a new issue and assign it to me
2) Inspect mail queue, observe that an email is waiting, refresh screen
periodically and see queue become empty
3) Email to me never arrives
4) On same issue, invoke operation "Assign issue", give it a comment and
assign it to me
5) Receive email with comment.

So, in summary, I don't receive the first assign email, but I do receive
later ones.

Is this a bug?

David
fields.summary: Email notification - fails on first assignment

fields.description: RSS feeds are already available as the results of a filter search in jira, which works very nice for linking with aggregation tools.  It would also be cool if comments for an issue could be read as an RSS feed, as a means of monitoring the issue instead of subscribing/watching.
fields.summary: Add an RSS feed query for comments to individual issues

fields.description: Add the ability to permalink to a specific issue comment, I'm finding I often wish to refer to a specific comment, often in source code comments, rather than the issue in general.
fields.summary: Add permalink's to issue comments

fields.description:
When viewing an issue, the top row contains various dates:

Created: 15/Jul/03 09:34 AM  Updated: 16/Jul/03 12:49 PM  Due: 06/Jul/03 

A small but nice useability improvement would be to have time since "now", with the static date in brackets, or as a rollover, eg:

Created: 1 day, 1 hour, 2 mins ago (15/Jul/03 09:34 AM)
Due: 6 hours, 5 mins (16/Jul/03 09:34 AM)

--Jeff
fields.summary: Display dates as relative to current time

fields.description: sinse upgrading to version 2.3 I have noticed that when you do a quick search, the issue will not be found if you enter the case incorrectly.  All I keys are uppercase but usually people enter them lower case when doing quick searches.
fields.summary: Issue Keys are noew case-sensitive when doing a quick search

fields.description: After selecting the 'Browse Project' Button the overview page for the project shows a negative number. I guess this happens after deleting issues.
fields.summary: No component under Browse Project shows a negative number

fields.description: Can Jira be easily translated in other languages?
fields.summary: Internationalization

fields.description: Once a developed has worklogged an issue, it seems impossible to delete or modify its log if he made a mistake. For example, if instead of 30 minutes I write 30 days, that number will stay forever :/
fields.summary: Cannot delete/update work logged
change page contents of 'find issue' when no filter selected

fields.description: I had a test license which expired. I went to the web site to buy a license. I have also sent e-mails. If it would not be too much trouble on your side, I would like to send you money in exchange for a license.
fields.summary: Need a license

fields.description:
Commit LDAPCredentialsProvider.java patch to OSUser to ensure that users cannot login with empty passwords (due to allowed LDAP anonymous access).

NOTE: the patch also restricts the authentication of users that are in LDAP to LDAP ONLY. i.e. if the user is in LDAP he/she will not be able to login with a password from another credentials provider, but only with the LDAP password. Users that do NOT exist in LDAP will be authenticated against other credential providers.
fields.summary: Commit LDAPCredentialsProvider.java patch to OSUser.

fields.description: Save Filters popup shows "null" when no description entered
fields.summary: Save Filters popup shows "null" when no description entered

fields.description:
If you click the name of a project from the Refresh Statistics page, you get the following URL:

/secure/admin/BrowseProject.jspa?id=xxxxx

This shows the browse project view, but wrapped inside of the admin navigation template.  This is ok, but presumably it's mean to not have "admin/" in the URL?

(You can apply the same view to the ViewIssue.jspa link page - just throw admin into the URL, and the diff view template is applied. Don't know if there's a way, or even any need to bother trying to stop this.)
fields.summary: Click project name from Refresh Stats shows view in the admin template

fields.description:
The “all projects” portlet would be a nice spot from where one can choose which projects may be shown in the portal and which may not. Currently all projects a user has access/permission to are being shown on the portal. A checkbox in front of each project link in the “all projects” portlet can allow the user to select only the projects he/she is currently interested in. 

The possibility to promote a “global filter” to a portlet so it can be added to the default dashboard.
fields.summary: New portlets
New reports tab + report

fields.description: Work logs should be editable by admins after they have been posted by developers.
fields.summary: Work logs should be editable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2018].
  {panel}

Concerning permission scheme administration, we've got a proposal to relieve some stress of a jira admin ;-)

Currently it's possible to copy an existing scheme. However, the new scheme is called "copy of ..." and contains the exact same groups as its ancestor (the original). Usually we want to copy a scheme but we want the same "kind" of groups in the new scheme but they have different names. An example.

Suppose we've got a project called XXXX with its associated permission scheme XXXX.

Permission scheme XXXX contains the following groups:
-          XXXX-users
-          XXXX-developers
-          XXXX-administrators

We create a new project YYYY and want permission scheme YYYY. For this group YYYY we want the same groups as in scheme XXXX with different but analogous names.

Scheme YYYY
-          YYYY-users
-          YYYY-developers
-          YYYY-administrators

So, actually, these were a lot of words to ask only for a possibility to do a "find/replace" when copying a permission scheme. Automatically creating the new groups of the new scheme if they don't exist yet is yet another small thing to make the life of an admin a little less painful :-)
fields.summary: permission scheme administration improvements

fields.description:
When releaseing a version you get a (new) option to move open issues to an unreleased version. When doing so, all statistics are updated but issues are still pointed to old (and now) released version.

Statistics showed 27 issues for the new unreleased version, but clicking it showed only 7 (even after reindex and refresh statistics).

When updating issues manually, statistics went bersert (-22 errors in now released version). That was recaluculated and showed the correct answer afterwards.
fields.summary: Release -> Move open issues to unrelesed version does not work

fields.description:
We've just shown Jira to yet another new group who will be the first to actually use the voting feature.  They want something simple, but seemingly missing - to show 'Popular issues' on the dashboard.  Thought that should be easy, but in fact there is no way to do this.

Likewise, there is no way to export the ten most popular issues to Excel, for example.  It seems you can vote for issues, but support for using this information is quite limited.
fields.summary: Make popular issues fully featured.
Allow Personal Roadmap as portlet

fields.description:
When changing the permissions I encountered the following bug :

If you have users that are a member of jira-administrators and/or jira-develipers and/or owngroupname that are not a member of the jira-users group thet aren't able to login!!!!!

This caused the program to lock us out (I had only administrators, the users where following later).

Only solution was reentering the records true sql to get back in the program (It took me a while to figure this one out!!!)

There has to be a change because this means that selfmade administrator groups with all permissions still can't login to JIRA if there not a jira-user.

I guess that everybody has2be a member of jira-users.
If you want to keep this then I suggest you make it stick (always a member of jira-users and not able to remove the jira-users group from a user !!!)

Regards

Kristof
fields.summary: can't login if not a mamber of jira-users

fields.description:
I would like to have a timestamp on each change that has been made to an issue. That is Comments, Work log and History. Today only date is visible.

The reason for this:
I'm a test manager at isMobile in Sweden. And sometimes we have several system builds each day. And I would like to be able to track down in which deploy the changes has been implemented.
fields.summary: Timestamp in issue history
